title: The Best iPhone SE Cases of 2024
description: Looking for a way to protect your iPhone SE? Here are some of the best cases money can buy.
author: Jon Bitner
excerpt: Looking for a way to protect your iPhone SE? Here are some of the best cases money can buy.
text: Apple iPhone Sign in to your How-To Geek account Justin Duino / How-To Geek With dozens of iPhone SE cases on the market, finding a reliable one can be a challenge. Whether you need tough protection, a slim design, or multiple cases for different situations, we have the best recommendations for you. Best Overall iPhone SE Silicone Case Offered in four unique colors and with a surprisingly affordable price tag, Apple's own Silicone Case stands as the best iPhone SE case on the market. Best Budget Case Spigen Tough Armor $17 $40 Save $23 The Spigen Tough Armor design is a bit quirky, but its built-in kickstand and impressive protection make it a great option for shoppers on a budget. Promoted Pick SUPCASE UB Edge Pro This SUPCASE offering comes with a clear back and built-in screen protector, so you can make sure your SE is protected for months to come. Best Clear Case ESR Clear (iPhone SE 2022) $7 $10 Save $3 Keep the sleek aesthetic of your iPhone SE with the ESR Clear Case. This transparent case features precise cutouts for all your phone's ports and speakers, and is compatible with wireless charging. Best Rugged Case UAG Pathfinder for iPhone SE Tough, but lightweight and slim, the UAG Pathfinder offers rugged Military-grade protection for your iPhone SE and is compatible with wireless charging and Apple Pay for everyday convenience. Best Wallet Case TUCCH iPhone SE Case The TUCCH iPhone SE Case will keep both your iPhone and credit cards safe from damage, although it's a rather bulky product. Best Thin Case Spigen Thin Fit Case You'll be left with a few exposed ports and buttons, but Spigen's Thin Fit Case is barely noticeable on the iPhone SE. Best Leather Case Snakehive Vintage Wallet Case $39 $43 Save $4 Protective, stylish, and made from premium materials, the Snakehive Vintage Wallet is among the best-looking iPhone SE cases on the market. Just be careful not to damage the leather exterior, which is prone to scratches and stains. What to Look For in an iPhone SE Case Finding a protective iPhone SE case is surprisingly challenging. Not only do you need to make sure you're shopping for the correct SE model, but you'll need to wade through hundreds of products from dozens of manufacturersâ€”some of which aren't built to withstand significant impact. However, if you know where you're looking, there are plenty of great options. The easiest way to find a good iPhone SE case is to stick with long-standing manufacturers such as ZAGG, Spigen, and OtterBox. These companies have been producing high-quality cases for years, and you can be certain that their lineup of iPhone SE cases is built to the same standards. You'll also want to consider how much protection you need for your new iPhone. If you're prone to dropping your phone or standing up with it on your lap, you'd be best served with something that covers all ports and buttons. If you need it to fit in a pocket for ease of use, opting for a slim fit or clear case is a better choice. Be sure to think carefully about how (and where) you plan on using your iPhone before springing for a case.
html:
Apple iPhone

Sign in to your How-To Geek account

With dozens of iPhone SE cases on the market, finding a reliable one can be a challenge. Whether you need tough protection, a slim design, or multiple cases for different situations, we have the best recommendations for you.

  • Best Overall

    iPhone SE Silicone Case

    Offered in four unique colors and with a surprisingly affordable price tag, Apple's own Silicone Case stands as the best iPhone SE case on the market.

  • Best Budget Case

    Spigen Tough Armor

    $17 $40 Save $23

    The Spigen Tough Armor design is a bit quirky, but its built-in kickstand and impressive protection make it a great option for shoppers on a budget.

  • Promoted Pick

    SUPCASE UB Edge Pro

    This SUPCASE offering comes with a clear back and built-in screen protector, so you can make sure your SE is protected for months to come.

  • Best Clear Case

    ESR Clear (iPhone SE 2022)

    $7 $10 Save $3

    Keep the sleek aesthetic of your iPhone SE with the ESR Clear Case. This transparent case features precise cutouts for all your phone's ports and speakers, and is compatible with wireless charging.

  • Best Rugged Case

    UAG Pathfinder for iPhone SE

    Tough, but lightweight and slim, the UAG Pathfinder offers rugged Military-grade protection for your iPhone SE and is compatible with wireless charging and Apple Pay for everyday convenience.

  • Best Wallet Case

    TUCCH iPhone SE Case

    The TUCCH iPhone SE Case will keep both your iPhone and credit cards safe from damage, although it's a rather bulky product.

  • Best Thin Case

    Spigen Thin Fit Case

    You'll be left with a few exposed ports and buttons, but Spigen's Thin Fit Case is barely noticeable on the iPhone SE.

  • Best Leather Case

    Snakehive Vintage Wallet Case

    $39 $43 Save $4

    Protective, stylish, and made from premium materials, the Snakehive Vintage Wallet is among the best-looking iPhone SE cases on the market. Just be careful not to damage the leather exterior, which is prone to scratches and stains.

What to Look For in an iPhone SE Case

Finding a protective iPhone SE case is surprisingly challenging. Not only do you need to make sure you're shopping for the correct SE model, but you'll need to wade through hundreds of products from dozens of manufacturersâ€”some of which aren't built to withstand significant impact.

However, if you know where you're looking, there are plenty of great options. The easiest way to find a good iPhone SE case is to stick with long-standing manufacturers such as ZAGG, Spigen, and OtterBox. These companies have been producing high-quality cases for years, and you can be certain that their lineup of iPhone SE cases is built to the same standards.

You'll also want to consider how much protection you need for your new iPhone. If you're prone to dropping your phone or standing up with it on your lap, you'd be best served with something that covers all ports and buttons. If you need it to fit in a pocket for ease of use, opting for a slim fit or clear case is a better choice. Be sure to think carefully about how (and where) you plan on using your iPhone before springing for a case.
